name: Mythical Creatures, Demons, and Fairies Quiz | Humanities | 10 Questions

questions.text: Japan: A creature was spotted with a tortoise-shell. On the top of its dented head, was a clear-fluid which gave it magical powers...Beware of this creature- for it is said they will suck out your volition and entrails. What is it?
questions.explanation:
kappa.

	The only way to escape a Kappa is to bow, so that the liquid spills out out from the top of its head.

questions.text: Scotland: A centaur appearing without skin, often amphibious with webbed-feet. What is it?
New Zealand:A green-skinned fairy living in the waters with a phosphorescent inner glow.
India: The buffalo-demon of Hinduism found in the epics of Markandeya Purana.
questions.explanation:
Mahisha.

	The buffalo is the symbol of death.

questions.text: Persia: In the writings of Firdausi- this creature sports claws, large teeth, horns, and a flashing tail.
Canada: A giant, man-eating creature with a heart made from ice.

India: Night-wanderers possessing the heads of cows and potbellies. Razor-sharp teeth protruding, with huge -leafy-like ears....they have been known to devour horses and humans in one sitting. What are they?
Judaism: The King of all demons with 3-heads. One is a bull, the other a ram, and the third an ogre....he is the son of Naamah and the husband to Lilith.
Babylonia: He embodied pestilence in ancient times. He had 4 wings, lion-paws, head of a dog, and a scorpion-tail.
Norway: A female shape-shifter that tormented sleeping men.
